citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
Following the facility’s 04/09/2024 and 08/27/2024 semi-annual reviews of its animal care and use program and animal
facility inspections, the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) failed to prepare and submit reports to the
Institutional Official (IO). Reports completed by the IACUC ensures the Institutional Official is informed and up to date
regarding the current status of the facility’s adherence to the Animal Welfare Act. These reports must be submitted to the
Institutional Official and updated at least once every six months upon completion of the required evaluations. The reports
shall be reviewed and signed by a majority of the IACUC members, contain any minority views, and contain a description
of the nature and extent of the facility’s adherence to the requirements in the Animal Welfare Act.
Correct from this day, 11/07/2024, forward.

The facility’s contingency plan has not been reviewed on at least an annual basis. The last review of the contingency plan
occurred in 2022, more than a year prior to the date of this inspection on 11/04/2024. Research facilities must review their
Continency Plan on at least an annual basis to ensure that it adequately addresses potential emergency situations or
disasters that could be detrimental to the health and well-being of the animals. The research facility must review the
contingency plan and maintain documentation of all annual reviews, including documenting any amendments or changes
made to the plan since the previous year’s review.
Correct by 12/01/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
